interlinear-text.item: The hunter and the white snake

phrase.item: A long time ago there was a hunter.
One day in winter he went hunting, he fell and got stuck in a crack.
He looked around [and saw] various snakes.
From fear, he sat in a corner and quietly stayed there.
The snakes all attacked him.
[But then] one white snake sat on a flat stone and didn't let other snakes harm the brave man, [palawon refers to a man who is heroic like Rustam and other Persian heroes]
Night passed and day came.
Three months passed like that. The hero stayed in the crack and the white snake protected him.
One day the milk-snake told a very long snake, "Take the young man out of the crack."
The young man held the snake's tail and came out of the crack.
The snakes told the hero, "Do not say anything about us to anyone, and if you do you will get in trouble."
So, the young man returned home.
All the neighbors were surprised and said: "We held a funeral for you."
tʃəroɣ pitsvak is special death ceremony.
"Where you were all these three months?"
The young man said, "I got stuck in a bear crack".
"Then I slaughtered a bear and put on its skin."
"When spring came, the older bears thought I was also a bear."
"Then they took me out of that crack."
"I could barely get rid of them."
Then he entered the house and was happy with his wife and children.
The king became aware of this news and the young man was taken to the king's palace.
He told his story and the king's children didn't believe him.
Then they gave the young man a hard time and finally he told them the real story.
He said, "I fell in a crack and there were a lot of snakes."
"One milk-snake protected me from the other snakes."
The king took his people, mullahs, and the young man up there.
They went to the snake's house and the mullahs started praying.
Then they entered the crack.
The snakes killed all of them and left only the young man alive.
The white snake told him, "We did you a favor, but you showed them our place."
Then it [the white snake] spit on his face.
The young man got home and then his hands and legs dried up [withered/stopped working].
For you I also advise that when you promise someone [something] do not break it.
[Or else] you will not be a hero. [This will not make you a hero.]
